body: Maybe she was mad at me. Hell, maybe I deserved it. The people I kept in touch with were always based on how close-by they were rather than who they were, and by the end of last year I would spent nights sitting around doing nothing in my neighbor’s dormroom before even thinking about Grace.

I was starting to remember more when as I thought  about it. She’d tried to set things up a couple of times, but I told her I was busy, which was kind of true. No, actually it was a total lie. I felt my jaw clench when I envisioned her mentioning all the times I’d flaked on her. One word to set her off, and she would start spilling everything out like opening a cabinet crammed with fine china.
But I needed to focus on getting the monologue read before she returned.

Picking up her paper loosely, I was hit again by the brute force of the its length. I already knew what recommendation number one would be: make it shorter. My monkey brain shouldn’t have had that much trouble looking at it. As my eyes ran down the length of the page, I suddenly found myself halted at a particular spot.
